intro: Heimia myrtifolia, commonly known as the red mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Heimia myrtifolia thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping in arid regions.
